etymology.description: 佛(佛) (Fó, "Buddha") + 教(教) (jiào, "teach; religion") + 徒(徒) (tú, "follower; disciple")
etymology.interpretation: The word 佛教徒 refers to someone who follows the teachings of 佛(佛) (Fó, "Buddha") within the framework of 教(教) (jiào, "religion"), emphasizing their role as a 徒(徒) (tú, "follower") of Buddhism. Buddhism, which originated in ancient India, is a major world religion centered on the teachings of the Buddha, and its followers strive to live by those principles.

examples.chinese: 他是一位虔诚的佛教徒(他是一位虔誠的佛教徒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī wèi qiánchéng de Fójiàotú.

examples.chinese: 在山间的古寺中(在山間的古寺中)，很多佛教徒聚集在一起(很多佛教徒聚集在一起)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shānjiān de gǔ sì zhōng, hěn duō Fójiàotú jùjí zài yìqǐ.
examples.english: In the ancient mountain temple, many Buddhists gather together.

examples.chinese: 从小受到佛教智慧熏陶的他(從小受到佛教智慧薰陶的他)，如今是一名虔诚的佛教徒(如今回是一名虔誠的佛教徒)。
examples.pinyin: Cóng xiǎo shòudào Fójiào zhìhuì xūntáo de tā, rújīn shì yī míng qiánchéng de Fójiàotú.
examples.english: He, who was nurtured by Buddhist wisdom since childhood, is now a devout Buddhist.
